intro: Gurania pyrrhocephala, commonly known as the red-headed gurania, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking red flowers that bloom in clusters, often attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are typically ovate and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Gurania pyrrhocephala is often found in moist, well-drained soils in forest understories or along stream banks.
